attributes.action: Penalise potential Landlords for pulling out of an agreement without reason.
attributes.additional_details:
While potential tenants are charged the holding deposit fee if they pull out, there is no fee for a landlord unjustly pulling out without reason.

While there are legitimate reasons to pull out of a tenancy, such as a potential tenants not passing references, the landlord should be held to the same standard as the tenants during the the process, and be charged a fee once an offer is accepted if they exit the agreement without just reason.
attributes.background:
Potential tenants are charged the holding deposit fee if they decide to not go ahead with the tenancy.
Landlords should be should be held to the same standard, paying a fee for wasting time and money of the letting agent and tenants, as well as potentially leaving the tenants without a home.
